title: Forces at lowest point on track

content.question: The magnitude of the gravitational force exerted on the block is <math alttext="F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the magnitude of the normal force exerted by the track on the block is <math alttext="F sub n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly compares the magnitudes of these two forces when the block is at the lowest point on the track?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub n is greater than F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub n equals F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub n is less than F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
The magnitudes cannot be compared without knowing the radius of the arc of the track.

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub n is greater than F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
